subject: AI & Agents
title: AlphaFold: Solving Protein Folding
description: A fast breakdown of AlphaFold: Solving Protein Folding for builders.

hook.text: For 50 years, biologists couldn't predict how proteins fold. In 2020, AI solved it.

buildup.text: Protein structure determines function. Knowing the shape unlocks drug design and disease understanding.

discovery.text: DeepMind's AlphaFold2 predicted protein structures with accuracy rivaling experimental methods.

twist.text: It then predicted structures for nearly every known protein â€” 200 million â€” and released them freely.

climax.text: AlphaFold won the Nobel Prize equivalent in biology â€” the Breakthrough Prize â€” and changed science.

punchline.text: AI didn't just help biology. It leaped it forward by decades.

quiz.question: Why was protein folding prediction so important?
options: Protein shape determines function, unlocking drug design
